newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Astra to open Australia research centre.
newsitem.headline: Astra to open Australia research centre.

text.p: Swedish drugs company Astra is planning to open a research centre in Australia as part of an expansion programme, a Swedish newspaper said on Sunday.
Astra plans to take on 700 new research staff in Sweden and overseas as it reshapes its research programme over the next three years, Svenska Dagbladet said.
Currently Astra has about 750 reseachers in Sweden and 250 overseas and an annual research budget of about eight billion crowns, the paper said.
But Astra intends to take on a further 400 researchers in Sweden and 300 elsewhere, concentrating its work in six centres, of which five will be in Sweden and one in Australia, the paper said.
"My aim is to make Astra the best in the world in pre-clinical research," Jan Lundberg, head of the Astra's pre-clinical division, told the paper.
He said half of Astra's annual research budget is spent testing new drugs, while a large part of its resources go towards getting approval for new treatments.
About two billion crowns a year is spent on further research on drugs that have already been approved.
